subject: Re: [junit] Integrating rspec and JUnit

messageBody:
Thanks, I think so too :)

I think that with custom runners JUnit has a good chance to be the adapter
between a whole host of testing frameworks out there and any tool that runs
tests.
Since JUnit is supported by most IDE:s (is there any IDE that does not have
JUnit support?) there is a lot to win by being JUnit compatible even if it's
only for IDE and ant, maven etc support.

If I were rolling my own test-framework I would definitely see if I could
fit my core-edge within the JUnit custom-runner framework and let others
worry about eclipse, ant, maven, netbeans, idea,
raven and whatever else is out there -support.

It will be interesting to see if more "adapters" will be written this way in
the future. Which one is the next one? TestNG?
This custom runner stuff is cool! Keep up the good work!
